description: Explore trigonometric functions, identities, and applications

slides.title: Welcome to Trigonometry
slides.content:
# Introduction to Trigonometry

Welcome to **Trigonometry** - the study of triangles and waves!

## What You Will Learn:
- **Trigonometric Ratios** - sin, cos, tan
- **Unit Circle** - Angles and coordinates
- **Identities** - Key relationships
- **Inverse Functions** - Finding angles
- **Applications** - Real-world uses

> **Fun Fact:** Ancient astronomers used trigonometry to calculate distances to stars!

slides.title: Right Triangle Ratios
slides.content:
# Right Triangle Trigonometry

## SOH-CAH-TOA:

| Function | Definition |
|----------|------------|
| sin(theta) | Opposite / Hypotenuse |
| cos(theta) | Adjacent / Hypotenuse |
| tan(theta) | Opposite / Adjacent |

## Reciprocal Functions:
| Function | Definition |
|----------|------------|
| csc(theta) | 1 / sin |
| sec(theta) | 1 / cos |
| cot(theta) | 1 / tan |

## Remember:
- The angle determines the ratios
- Hypotenuse is always longest

slides.title: Special Angles
slides.content:
# Special Angles

## Common Values:

| Angle | sin | cos | tan |
|-------|-----|-----|-----|
| 0 | 0 | 1 | 0 |
| 30 | 1/2 | sqrt(3)/2 | sqrt(3)/3 |
| 45 | sqrt(2)/2 | sqrt(2)/2 | 1 |
| 60 | sqrt(3)/2 | 1/2 | sqrt(3) |
| 90 | 1 | 0 | undefined |

## Memory Tricks:
- 30-60-90 triangle: sides 1, sqrt(3), 2
- 45-45-90 triangle: sides 1, 1, sqrt(2)

slides.title: Unit Circle
slides.content:
# The Unit Circle

## Definition:
Circle with radius 1 centered at origin.

## Key Points:
For angle theta, the point is (cos(theta), sin(theta)).

## Quadrants:
| Quadrant | Signs (sin, cos) |
|----------|------------------|
| I | +, + |
| II | +, - |
| III | -, - |
| IV | -, + |

## Reference Angles:
- Acute angle to x-axis
- Same trig value magnitudes

## Memory: All Students Take Calculus
- All positive in I
- Sin positive in II
- Tan positive in III
- Cos positive in IV

slides.title: Radians
slides.content:
# Radians

## Definition:
Angle measure based on arc length.

## Conversion:
```
180 degrees = pi radians
1 radian = 180/pi degrees â‰ˆ 57.3 degrees
```

## Common Values:
| Degrees | Radians |
|---------|--------|
| 0 | 0 |
| 30 | pi/6 |
| 45 | pi/4 |
| 60 | pi/3 |
| 90 | pi/2 |
| 180 | pi |
| 360 | 2*pi |

## Why Radians:
- Simpler calculus formulas
- Natural for circular motion

slides.title: Graphing Trig Functions
slides.content:
# Graphing Trigonometric Functions

## Sine and Cosine:
- Period: 2*pi
- Amplitude: 1
- Range: [-1, 1]

## General Form:
```
y = A*sin(B(x - C)) + D
```
- A = Amplitude
- Period = 2*pi/B
- C = Phase shift
- D = Vertical shift

## Tangent:
- Period: pi
- Vertical asymptotes at pi/2 + n*pi
- Range: All real numbers

slides.title: Pythagorean Identities
slides.content:
# Pythagorean Identities

## Main Identity:
```
sin^2(x) + cos^2(x) = 1
```

## Derived Identities:
```
1 + tan^2(x) = sec^2(x)
1 + cot^2(x) = csc^2(x)
```

## Rearrangements:
```
sin^2(x) = 1 - cos^2(x)
cos^2(x) = 1 - sin^2(x)
```

## Using These:
- Simplify expressions
- Verify identities
- Solve equations

slides.title: Sum and Difference Formulas
slides.content:
# Sum and Difference Formulas

## Sine:
```
sin(A + B) = sin(A)cos(B) + cos(A)sin(B)
sin(A - B) = sin(A)cos(B) - cos(A)sin(B)
```

## Cosine:
```
cos(A + B) = cos(A)cos(B) - sin(A)sin(B)
cos(A - B) = cos(A)cos(B) + sin(A)sin(B)
```

## Tangent:
```
tan(A + B) = (tan(A) + tan(B)) / (1 - tan(A)tan(B))
```

## Uses:
- Find exact values
- Simplify expressions

slides.title: Double and Half Angle
slides.content:
# Double and Half Angle Formulas

## Double Angle:
```
sin(2x) = 2*sin(x)*cos(x)
cos(2x) = cos^2(x) - sin^2(x)
       = 2*cos^2(x) - 1
       = 1 - 2*sin^2(x)
tan(2x) = 2*tan(x) / (1 - tan^2(x))
```

## Half Angle:
```
sin(x/2) = +/- sqrt((1 - cos(x)) / 2)
cos(x/2) = +/- sqrt((1 + cos(x)) / 2)
```

## Sign Choice:
Depends on quadrant of x/2.

slides.title: Inverse Trig Functions
slides.content:
# Inverse Trigonometric Functions

## Notation:
```
arcsin(x) = sin^(-1)(x)
arccos(x) = cos^(-1)(x)
arctan(x) = tan^(-1)(x)
```

## Domains and Ranges:
| Function | Domain | Range |
|----------|--------|-------|
| arcsin | [-1, 1] | [-pi/2, pi/2] |
| arccos | [-1, 1] | [0, pi] |
| arctan | All R | (-pi/2, pi/2) |

## Purpose:
- Find angle given ratio
- Solve trig equations

slides.title: Law of Sines and Cosines
slides.content:
# Law of Sines and Cosines

## Law of Sines:
```
a/sin(A) = b/sin(B) = c/sin(C)
```

## Use When:
- AAS, ASA, SSA cases

## Law of Cosines:
```
c^2 = a^2 + b^2 - 2*a*b*cos(C)
```

## Use When:
- SAS, SSS cases

## Area Formula:
```
Area = (1/2)*a*b*sin(C)
```

slides.title: Applications
slides.content:
# Applications of Trigonometry

## Navigation:
- Finding distances
- Bearing calculations

## Physics:
- Waves and oscillations
- Projectile motion
- Circular motion

## Engineering:
- Structural analysis
- Electrical circuits (AC)

## Astronomy:
- Measuring distances
- Satellite orbits

## Sound and Music:
- Wave analysis
- Harmonics

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Trigonometry Summary

## Basic Ratios:
- sin = Opp/Hyp
- cos = Adj/Hyp
- tan = Opp/Adj

## Key Identities:
```
sin^2 + cos^2 = 1
sin(2x) = 2*sin(x)*cos(x)
cos(2x) = cos^2(x) - sin^2(x)
```

## Unit Circle:
- (cos(theta), sin(theta))
- Radians vs degrees

## Triangle Laws:
| Law | Formula |
|-----|--------|
| Sines | a/sin(A) = b/sin(B) |
| Cosines | c^2 = a^2 + b^2 - 2ab*cos(C) |

> **Congratulations!** You've completed Trigonometry!
